sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"旅行"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: journey, tour, travel, trip, voyage, excursion, expedition, cruise
means: journey ： 最普通用词，侧重指时间较长、距离较远的单程陆上旅行，也指水上或空中的旅行。
tour ： 指最后反回出发地，旅途中有停留游览点，距离可长可短，目的各异的周游或巡行。
travel ： 泛指旅行的行为而不指某次具体的旅行，多指到远方作长期旅行，不强调直接目的地，单、复数均可用。
trip ： 普通用词，口语多用，常指为公务或游玩作的较短暂的旅行。
voyage ： 指在水上旅行，尤指海上旅行，也可指空中旅行。
excursion ： 较正式用词，常指不超过一天的短时期娱乐性游玩，也可指乘火车或轮船往返特定景点的远足旅游。
expedition ： 指有特定目的远征或探险。
cruise ： 主要指乘船的游览并在多处停靠。

sentence.Network_en: Our tour prices bore little resemblance to those in the holiday brochures.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的旅游报价和那些度假手册里的价格相去甚远。

sentence.Network_en: The tour will include games against the Australian Barbarians.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次巡回赛将包括和澳大利亚野人队的比赛。

sentence.Network_en: He found the rigours of the tour too demanding.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发现这次旅行非常艰苦。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 3; also denoting a circular movement): from Old French, turn', via Latin from Greek tornos 'lathe'. Sense 1 dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.tran: 巡回访问;巡回演出；巡回比赛
entry.def: A tour is an organized trip that people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies go on to several different places, stopping to meet people or perform.

example.ex: The band are currently on a two-month tour of Europe...
example.tran: 乐队目前正在欧洲进行为期两个月的巡回演出。

example.ex: It will be the first official cricket tour of South Africa for 22 years.
example.tran: 这将是 22 年来南非首次正式的板球巡回赛。

entry.tran: 作巡回活动(或演出、比赛)
entry.def: When people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies tour, they go on a tour, for example in order to perform or to meet people.

example.ex: A few years ago they toured the country in a roadshow...
example.tran: 几年前他们在全国作了巡回演出。

example.ex: He toured for nearly two years and played 500 sell-out shows...
example.tran: 他巡回演出了近两年，500场演出场场爆满。

entry.def: A tour is a journey during which you visit several places that interest you.

example.ex: It was week five of my tour of the major cities of Europe.
example.tran: 那是我在欧洲主要城市游历的第 5 周。

entry.def: A tour is a short trip that you make round a place, for example round a historical building, so that you can look at it.

example.ex: ...a guided tour of a ruined Scottish castle.
example.tran: 由导游带领游览苏格兰荒废城堡

entry.def: If you tour a place, you go on a journey or trip round it.

example.ex: You can also tour the site on modern coaches equipped with videos...
example.tran: 您也可以乘坐配有视频设备的现代化长途汽车游览那处遗址。

example.ex: We toured the streets of Milan.
example.tran: 我们游览了米兰的街道。

means.word_mean: 1. a journey or route all the way around a particular place or area;

sentences.sentence: "they took an extended tour of Europe"
"we took a quick circuit of the park"
"a ten-day coach circuit of the island"

means.word_mean: 2. a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else);
3. a period of time spent in military service
1. make a tour of a certain place;

example.en: I just wanted a look, not a damn Cook's tour.
example.zh: 我想只要看一眼，而不是想要一本正经的参观游览。

de加强动作+tour转→转着走→迂回的路

Sentence.sentence: They want to know if we'd be interested in sponsoring a tour they want to make to East Asia.
It is planning to tour East Asia
He might give up concert tours.

sentences.cn: 我的旅行持续了两个月。

sentences.en: He is in the United States on a speaking tour.
sentences.cn: 他正在美国作巡回演讲。

jushi.english: They decided to make a round-the-world tour.
He has gone on a tour to Europe.
He served three years in England.
